item.title: Christabelle add a quote by John Eldredge
item.description: "Worship is the act of the abandoned heart adoring its God" -- John Eldredge

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Mama's love had always been the kind that acted itself out with soup pot and sewing basket. But now that these things were taken away, the love seemed as whole as before. She sat in her chair at the window and loved us. She loved the people she saw in the street-- and beyond: her love took in the city, the land of Holland, the world. And so I learned that love is larger than the walls which shut it in. " -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Barbara Johnson
item.description: "To be in your children's memories tomorrow, You have to be in their lives today." -- Barbara Johnson

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Christabelle add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa
